info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 3:42PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Catawba, southeastern Caldwell and southeastern Burke Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 342 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Morganton, or near Rutherford College, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Longview, Sawmills, Granite Falls, Valdese, Icard, Drexel, Hildebran, Connelly Springs, Rutherford College and Rhodhiss. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
